title: Sans Serif Font - Help
content:
Can anyone ID this font?

[http://www.tmdesign.net/typeface.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081004234831/http:/www.tmdesign.net/typeface.jpg "http://www.tmdesign.net/typeface.jpg")

 [‹ "Oriental style" font - Academy](http://web.archive.org/web/20081004234831/http:/typophile.com/node/16527 "Go to previous forum topic") [NICO ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081004234831/http:/typophile.com/node/16463 "Go to next forum topic")
author: elabdesigns

comments.content:
It looks similar to Locator but the J is off.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/locator/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081004234831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/locator/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/locator/")
Looks good to me too. Thanks!
I have done work for Jaguar (for a local dealership) and can confirm FF Din is the typeface they use.
